definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: She was hardly overstating the case.
The "two- shotting" is a little exaggerated in most cases.
sentences.chinese: 顯然“兩個神騎定九州”的論點多少有點言過其實。

sentences.english: It also claims the number of deaths has been inflated.
sentences.chinese: 它還宣稱的死亡人數一直是言過其實的。

sentences.english: Perhaps the jaw-dropping effect of the bra itself is what really does the trick, however.
sentences.chinese: 也許這種胸罩的效果有點言過其實。
這種美元下跌論言過其實了。
通常都言過其實，無法兌現。

sentences.english: Leakey was exaggerating but not by much.
sentences.chinese: Leakey言過其實但並沒有太誇張。

sentences.english: Most epigrams exaggerate for effect, and this is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 警句爲了求效果大多言過其實，這句也不例外。

definition: lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
the four great Chinese inventions: paper, printing, magnetic compass and gunpowder
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
